title: Huge ugly rays with city lights at night. How to avoid it?
content:
Sometimes at night, city lights generate hugo light rays on photos. It is ugly and I don't know how to set the camera to avoid it.

It looks like it depends a lot on the current light in the scene as the phenomenon is not systematic.

Sometimes it is there, sometimes, there is only a small halo effect that one can tolerate on night time shots....

Is there a setting to avoid the large rays effect?

See the pictures attached. The photo without the rays was taken on an other day, all photos taken in night mode.
